intro: Cyphostemma kundelunguense, commonly known as the Congo moonvine, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
